Class GameOfLifeGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • GameOfLifeGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GameOfLifeGUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class is the visualization of the game board. It extends the JFrame class and is adapted with several GUI elements.
    Author:
    Adrian Mark
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setCellAlive

        public void setCellAlive(CellPanel p)

        Parameters:
        p - - The CellPanel that represents the Cell that is revived

      • setCellDead

        public void setCellDead(CellPanel p)
        This method sets the color of the CellPanel to white and kills the Cell at the respective position on the Board in the background
        Parameters:
        p - - The CellPanel that represents the Cell that is killed

      • updateVisibleBoard

        public void updateVisibleBoard(boolean showExtinctionMessage)
        This method applies the changes that were computed in the Board class in the background to the visible board on the GameOfLifeGUI.
        Parameters:
        showExtinctionMessage - - Indicates whether a message is desired if the number of living cells is zero

      • setSizeOfBoard

        public void setSizeOfBoard(int sizeX,
                           int sizeY,
                           boolean wishesGrid)
        This method changes the dimensions of both, the visible board on the GUI and the Board in the background.
        Parameters:
        sizeX - - new width of the board
        sizeY - - new height of the board
        wishesGrid - - if true, show a box around each cell
